file_content.text: Don't have time to stand around and talk. Need to watch out for the beasties....
Beryl's waiting for her core samples. You should go see her.
Hey, you got all the gear those scavengers stole. Turnabout's fair play, right?
Got those core samples, too. That'll make Beryl a happy lady. You should go see her right away.
These aren't core samples, Ovold--and you know it.
You lied to me.
Sure they are. That's the cargo pod I put them in. Don't tell me those scavengers dumped them out?
The cargo pod is full of Taris relics.
It contains artifacts.
I wouldn't say that too loud if I was you. It's illegal to run contraband on Taris.
It's alright, I'm not here to bust you.
Relax, I'm on your side.
I don't know what you're talking about.
Don't make me get ugly with you, pal.
Knock off the act.
I'm just an honest engineer earning a living out here.
I know all about the smuggling operation, pal.
Whatever you say, criminal.
Smuggling? That's illegal. I don't know anything about smuggling.
Tyrodall said differently. Remember him?
That's a lie.
Tyrodall? He's dead. Got eaten by rakghouls. Wouldn't have happened if he had goggles like mine.
Those relics didn't get in there by themselves, Ovold.
You expect me to believe that?
Is this some kind of practical joke or something?
I want hush money, right now.
Pay me or go to jail.
For what? I haven't done anything.
That cargo pod had core samples inside before the scavengers stole it!
If the pod has something else in it now, it's got nothing to do with me.
That's your story and you're sticking to it?
You'll hold to that?
It's the absolute truth, and nobody can prove otherwise.
Pay up, or I go to Republic Customs.
I'll turn you in.
Hey, hold on... I don't need trouble with the law. They might confiscate my goggles--and that'd be painful.
I'll give you my whole month's pay. Just leave me alone, all right?
You're smarter than you look.
Good call.
I'll go have a chat with Beryl now.
Time to see your boss.
See you around, worm-guts.
Coward.
Never should've gotten mixed up with you people....
Huh, you're a pretty good liar--I think it's the goggles.
You're very convincing.
That's what the guys at the sabacc table used to say, before they stopped letting me play with them.
Have a real nice day, Captain.
Have a nice life, goggle-head.
I plan to.
Tell Beryl I said hello, huh?
Good luck with those scavengers. Keep your eyes open out there.
Shhh... hold still. Big hungry beastie out there is watching us, about eight hundred meters away.
These Baktoid X-1 combat-goggles show me everything. I never take them off. Have to keep up my visual scanning for the beasties.
You never take those things off?
You always wear those goggles?
Thought I lost them, once. Bonded them to my skull with industrial adhesive. Now I'm always ready.
What kind of beast is out there?
Creature?
Not sure. Lots of carnivores here. That one ran off, but it'll be back. And I'll still be watching.
Bet you're big fun at parties.
You're a crazy person.
No parties out here, just hard living. Pay's good, though.
I'm Ovold, core-drilling engineer. Beryl sent a holo, told me you were coming. It's about time.
Scavengers raided the equipment stores three times last week. Took some good gear with them. Didn't get my goggles, though.
Who are these scavengers?
Scavengers?
Pirates, grave robbers, general scum of the galaxy. All looking to make credits off whatever they can steal.
Beryl said you have something for me to take back.
Do you have my stuff?
I used to, until the scavengers raided the camp.
I don't care about your blasted goggles.
Shut up about your gear.
Right, right. You're here for something else. Got some bad news about that.
The scavengers ran off with those planetary core samples you came to get for Beryl.
She can't finish her contract without them. Need you to get them back.
The scavengers must have a camp. Know where it is?
Point me at them.
They haven't had me over for dinner, so, no, I don't have real firm directions to their place.
Seems to me taking more core samples would be less dangerous.
Make more samples, instead.
They took the core-driller, too. Got a new one on order, but it'll be a few months.
What would scavengers want with core samples?
This doesn't make sense.
They were grabbing everything in sight. They probably thought the pod was something valuable.
Way I hear it, scavengers are pretty well organized. Got themselves a regular fortress. Real death trap.
If I had a credit for every death trap I've escaped, I wouldn't need this job.
No such thing.
I know what you mean.
Beryl owes me a hefty bonus for this.
I should raise my fee.
She's a generous lady. I'm sure you'll make out fine.
I'll burn their little clubhouse to the ground.
Only for them.
Things don't burn so well here, on account of the humidity. Feel free to try, though.
You're looking for a cargo pod marked "Taris core samples." Should be easy to pick out from everything else the scavengers stole.
Speaking of which, I'll pay extra for snatching the rest of my stolen gear. Need it to finish my work. Good luck out there....
Have to keep a close watch on things out here. Lots of hungry beasties looking for a snack, you know?
